examples.english: I am waiting for the bus.
She is waiting for her brother.
What do you wait for?
I am thinking about my vacation.
We are thinking about the future.
What do you think about?
They are looking for a solution.

examples.dutch: De politie zoekt naar de dader.
examples.english: The police are looking for the culprit.
What do you look for (abstract)?

translation.english: to love, to be fond of

examples.english: I love you.
He loves chocolate.
What do you love, to be fond of?
We are watching the movie.
Look at the stars!
What do you look at?
He is listening to the radio.
Are you listening to music?
What do you listen to?
They are talking about the weather.
What are you talking about?
What do you talk about?
You can count on me.
I am counting on your help.
What do you count on?

translation.english: to react to, to respond to

examples.english: I am responding to your email.
He reacts well to criticism.
What do you react to, to respond to?

examples.dutch: Zij zorgt voor haar zieke moeder.
examples.english: She is taking care of her sick mother.
Are you taking care of the dogs?
What do you take care of?

translation.english: to think about, to reflect on

examples.dutch: Ik moet nadenken over het aanbod.
examples.english: I have to think about the offer.

examples.dutch: Denk goed na over je toekomst.
examples.english: Think carefully about your future.
What do you think about, to reflect on?
We are starting with the lesson.

examples.dutch: Hij begint met een nieuwe baan.
examples.english: He is starting a new job.
What do you start with?
I am interested in art.

examples.dutch: Zijn ze geïnteresseerd in die auto?
examples.english: Are they interested in that car?
What do you be interested in?
He looks like his father.

examples.dutch: Deze bloem lijkt op een roos.
examples.english: This flower looks like a rose.
What do you look like, to resemble?

examples.dutch: Ik ben trots op mijn zoon.
examples.english: I am proud of my son.

examples.dutch: Ze is trots op haar werk.
examples.english: She is proud of her work.
What do you be proud of?

examples.dutch: De man vroeg naar de weg.
examples.english: The man asked for the way.
I asked about you.
What do you ask for?
I am afraid of spiders.

examples.dutch: Zij is niet bang voor de donker.
examples.english: She is not afraid of the dark.
What do you be afraid of?

examples.dutch: Doe je mee met het spel?
examples.english: Are you joining in the game?

examples.dutch: Hij wil niet meedoen met de discussie.
examples.english: He doesn't want to participate in the discussion.
What do you participate in?

examples.dutch: Je moet rekening houden met de buren.
examples.english: You have to take the neighbors into account.

examples.dutch: We moeten rekening houden met de kosten.
examples.english: We must take the costs into account.
What do you take into account?

examples.dutch: Ik droom van een reis naar Japan.
examples.english: I dream of a trip to Japan.

examples.dutch: Hij droomt van een beter leven.
examples.english: He dreams of a better life.
What do you dream of?
I am quitting smoking.
When are we stopping work?
What do you stop with?
I believe in God.
Do you believe in love?
What do you believe in?

examples.dutch: Hij klaagt altijd over het weer.
examples.english: He always complains about the weather.

examples.dutch: Waarom klaag je over je werk?
examples.english: Why are you complaining about your work?
What do you complain about?
I want to talk with you.
They are talking with their parents.
What do you talk with?

examples.dutch: Ik ben blij met mijn nieuwe huis.
examples.english: I am happy with my new house.

examples.dutch: Is hij blij met het resultaat?
examples.english: Is he happy with the result?
What do you be happy with?

examples.dutch: Ik moet betalen voor de koffie.
examples.english: I have to pay for the coffee.

examples.dutch: Hoeveel heb je betaald voor die tas?
examples.english: How much did you pay for that bag?
What do you pay for?

examples.dutch: Ik erger me aan het lawaai.
examples.english: I am annoyed by the noise.

examples.dutch: Hij ergert zich aan de lange rij.
examples.english: He is annoyed by the long queue.
What do you be annoyed by?
I trust your judgment.
You can trust us.
What do you trust in?

examples.dutch: Wij profiteren van de lage prijzen.
examples.english: We benefit from the low prices.
He is benefiting from the situation.
What do you benefit from?

examples.dutch: Ze doet mee aan de marathon.
examples.english: She is participating in the marathon.

examples.dutch: Wie doet er mee aan de wedstrijd?
examples.english: Who is participating in the contest?
What do you participate in?

examples.dutch: Ik werk aan een nieuw project.
examples.english: I am working on a new project.
She is working on her presentation.
What do you work on?

examples.dutch: De kinderen ruziën over het speelgoed.
examples.english: The children are arguing about the toy.
They argue about small things.
What do you argue about?
He is in love with her.

examples.dutch: Ik ben verliefd op de lente.
examples.english: I am in love with spring.
What do you be in love with?
I doubt his honesty.
She doubts the decision.
What do you doubt?

examples.dutch: Ik kies voor de blauwe auto.
examples.english: I choose the blue car.

examples.dutch: Heb je al gekozen voor een studie?
examples.english: Have you already chosen a major?
What do you choose for?

examples.dutch: Wij richten ons op de toekomst.
examples.english: We are focusing on the future.

examples.dutch: Hij richt zich op zijn studie.
examples.english: He is focusing on his studies.
What do you focus on?

examples.dutch: Ik heb een hekel aan onbeleefde mensen.
examples.english: I dislike rude people.

examples.dutch: Zij heeft een hekel aan vroeg opstaan.
examples.english: She dislikes waking up early.

examples.dutch: Waar heb je een hekel aan?
examples.english: What do you dislike?

examples.dutch: Bemoei je niet met mijn zaken.
examples.english: Don't interfere with my business.

examples.dutch: Waarom bemoeien jullie je met elkaar?
examples.english: Why are you interfering with each other?
What do you interfere with?

examples.dutch: Vergelijk deze appel met die appel.
examples.english: Compare this apple with that apple.

examples.dutch: Hij vergelijkt zijn leven met dat van zijn broer.
examples.english: He compares his life with his brother's.
What do you compare with?

examples.dutch: Zij schaamt zich voor haar fouten.
examples.english: She is ashamed of her mistakes.

examples.dutch: Ik schaam me niet voor wie ik ben.
examples.english: I am not ashamed of who I am.
What do you be ashamed of?
I am angry with him.

examples.dutch: De leraar is boos op de klas.
examples.english: The teacher is angry with the class.
What do you be angry with?

examples.dutch: Ik bereid me voor op het examen.
examples.english: I am preparing for the exam.

examples.dutch: Zij bereidt zich voor op de reis.
examples.english: She is preparing for the trip.
What do you prepare for?

examples.dutch: Hij is geslaagd voor zijn rijexamen.
examples.english: He passed his driving exam.

examples.dutch: Ik hoop te slagen voor de test.
examples.english: I hope to pass the test.
What do you pass (an exam)?

examples.dutch: Ik spaar voor een nieuwe fiets.
examples.english: I am saving for a new bicycle.
They are saving for their dream house.
What do you save for?

examples.dutch: Concentreren jullie je op de les?
examples.english: Are you concentrating on the lesson?

examples.dutch: Ik kan me niet concentreren op mijn werk.
examples.english: I can't concentrate on my work.
What do you concentrate on?

examples.dutch: De mensen protesteren tegen de nieuwe wet.
examples.english: The people are protesting against the new law.
They are protesting against the war.
What do you protest against?

examples.dutch: Hij sluit zich aan bij de groep.
examples.english: He is joining the group.

examples.dutch: Zij sluit zich aan bij de discussie.
examples.english: She is joining the discussion.
What do you join?

examples.dutch: Hij is verlaten door zijn vrouw.
examples.english: He has been left by his wife.

examples.dutch: De stad werd verlaten door haar inwoners.
examples.english: The city was left by its inhabitants.
What do you be left by?
Pay attention to what I am saying.

examples.dutch: Ze let goed op de details.
examples.english: She pays close attention to the details.
What do you pay attention to?
I am hoping for nice weather.

examples.dutch: Ze hopen op een goede afloop.
examples.english: They are hoping for a good outcome.
What do you hope for?

examples.dutch: Wij nemen deel aan de vergadering.
examples.english: We are taking part in the meeting.

examples.dutch: Ik neem deel aan de cursus.
examples.english: I am taking part in the course.
What do you take part in?

examples.dutch: Ik stuur een brief naar mijn oma.
examples.english: I am sending a letter to my grandma.

examples.dutch: Zij sturen een pakketje naar Nederland.
examples.english: They are sending a package to the Netherlands.
What do you send to?
I am enjoying the vacation.
We are enjoying the view.
What do you enjoy?

examples.dutch: Ik heb me in de datum vergist.
examples.english: I was mistaken about the date.

examples.dutch: Hij heeft zich in haar vergist.
examples.english: He was mistaken about her.
What do you be mistaken about?
I grew up in Amsterdam.

examples.dutch: Hij is opgegroeid in een klein dorp.
examples.english: He grew up in a small village.
What do you grow up in?

examples.dutch: Ik kijk uit naar het weekend.
examples.english: I am looking forward to the weekend.

examples.dutch: Zij kijkt uit naar de vakantie.
examples.english: She is looking forward to the vacation.
What do you look forward to?
I remember that moment.

examples.dutch: Hij herinnert zich niets van de avond.
examples.english: He doesn't remember anything from the evening.
What do you remember?

examples.dutch: Ik stel me aan je voor.
examples.english: I introduce myself to you.

examples.dutch: Stel je voor aan mijn vrienden.
examples.english: Introduce yourself to my friends.
What do you introduce oneself to?

examples.dutch: Wij bereiden ons voor voor de test.
examples.english: We are preparing for the test.

examples.dutch: Bereid je goed voor voor het examen.
examples.english: Prepare well for the exam.
What do you prepare for?

examples.dutch: Ik kan me moeilijk aanpassen aan de kou.
examples.english: I have difficulty adapting to the cold.

examples.dutch: De studenten passen zich snel aan aan de nieuwe omgeving.
examples.english: The students quickly adapt to the new environment.
What do you adapt to?

examples.dutch: Het gebouw bevindt zich in het centrum.
examples.english: The building is located in the center.
Where is the toilet located?
What do you be located in?

examples.dutch: Deze jas beschermt je tegen de regen.
examples.english: This jacket protects you against the rain.

examples.dutch: Wij moeten ons beschermen tegen het virus.
examples.english: We must protect ourselves against the virus.
What do you protect against?

examples.dutch: Ik vraag me af of hij komt.
examples.english: I wonder if he is coming.

examples.dutch: Ze vroeg zich af of de winkel open was.
examples.english: She wondered if the shop was open.
What do you wonder?

examples.dutch: Hij beklaagt zich over het slechte weer.
examples.english: He is complaining about the bad weather.

examples.dutch: Ze beklaagde zich over de service.
examples.english: She complained about the service.
What do you complain about?

examples.dutch: De studenten concentreren zich op hun huiswerk.
examples.english: The students are concentrating on their homework.

examples.dutch: Ik kan me niet concentreren op het geluid.
examples.english: I can't concentrate on the noise.
What do you concentrate on?

examples.dutch: Ik verheug me op de vakantie.
examples.english: I am looking forward to the vacation.

examples.dutch: Zij verheugt zich op haar verjaardag.
examples.english: She is looking forward to her birthday.
What do you look forward to?

examples.dutch: Ik vraag me af waarom hij wegging.
examples.english: I wonder why he left.

examples.dutch: Ze vraagt zich af waarom hij niet belde.
examples.english: She wonders why he didn't call.
Why do you wonder?

examples.dutch: Ik stoor me aan het lawaai van de buren.
examples.english: I am bothered by the neighbors' noise.

examples.dutch: Ze stoort zich aan zijn houding.
examples.english: She is bothered by his attitude.
What do you be bothered by?

examples.dutch: Ik heb me afgemeld voor de nieuwsbrief.
examples.english: I have unsubscribed from the newsletter.

examples.dutch: Zij meldt zich af voor de cursus.
examples.english: She is unsubscribing from the course.
What do you unsubscribe from?

examples.dutch: Hij verzet zich tegen de nieuwe regels.
examples.english: He is resisting the new rules.

examples.dutch: Zij verzetten zich tegen de veranderingen.
examples.english: They are resisting the changes.
What do you resist?
